context_evidences: - One U.S. official said the balloon was assessed to have 'limited additive value from an intelligence collection perspective.' Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/suspected-chinese-spy-balloon-flying-over-united-states-us-officials-2023-02-02/ published on 2023-02-02 22:35:57

- Another defense official said the Pentagon did not think that the balloon added much value over what China could glean through satellite imagery. Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/02/02/us/politics/china-spy-balloon-pentagon.html published on 2023-02-03 01:00:23

- The decision to publicize the discovery appears to put China on notice ahead of Mr. Blinken’s Beijing visit — the first by an American secretary of state in six years — during which he is expected to meet with President Xi Jinping. The sudden appearance of the balloon is bound to raise already escalating tensions between the two powers. Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/02/02/us/politics/china-spy-balloon-pentagon.html published on 2023-02-03 01:00:23

- The balloon is currently traveling at an altitude well above commercial air traffic and does not present a military or physical threat to people on the ground. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/suspected-chinese-spy-balloon-flying-over-united-states-us-officials-2023-02-02/ published on 2023-02-02 22:35:57
correction_response:
This tweet is misleading. President Biden did not stop fighters from shooting down the Chinese balloon due to being "China compromised". Rather, he accepted military leaders' advice against shooting it down due to safety concerns about debris. The balloon is not considered a significant military or intelligence threat. It's also worth noting that the balloon is flying at an altitude well above commercial air traffic, posing no physical threat to people on the ground. 
References: 
https://www.reuters.com/world/suspected-chinese-spy-balloon-flying-over-united-states-us-officials-2023-02-02/
https://www.nytimes.com/2023/02/02/us/politics/china-spy-balloon-pentagon.html
note_1_text: "The Pentagon decided not to shoot it down over concerns of hurting people on the ground."    "Similar balloon activity has been seen in the past several years."    "The U.S. took steps to ensure it did not collect sensitive information."  https://apnews.com/article/chinese-surveillance-balloon-united-states-montana-47248b0ef2b085620fcd866c105054be
note_2_text: The President asked for military options and the Chairman of the JCS strongly advised the President against kinetic action citing the lack of a threat, and the risk to those on the ground.  Military assets were made available, however, in case that because a necessity.     https://amp.cnn.com/cnn/2023/02/02/politics/us-tracking-china-spy-balloon/index.html?fbclid=IwAR0suUiP2iLpnHps4Sg3rFkwa4b7g2LTpKUMPVrT_lkfoXRIldog9P6hpNM

refute_evidences: - Fighter jets were mobilized, but military leaders advised President Joe Biden against shooting the balloon out of the sky for fear debris could pose a safety threat, advice Biden accepted, U.S. officials said. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/suspected-chinese-spy-balloon-flying-over-united-states-us-officials-2023-02-02/ published on 2023-02-02 22:35:57

- The official said that while it was not the first time China had sent spy balloons to the United States, this one has appeared to remain over the country for longer. Still, a senior administration official who spoke on the condition of anonymity said the balloon did not pose a military or physical threat and added that it had limited value in collecting intelligence. Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/02/02/us/politics/china-spy-balloon-pentagon.html published on 2023-02-03 01:00:23

- U.S. military leaders considered shooting down the balloon over Montana on Wednesday but eventually advised Biden against it because of the safety risk from debris, the official told reporters. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/suspected-chinese-spy-balloon-flying-over-united-states-us-officials-2023-02-02/ published on 2023-02-02 22:35:57

- President Biden has chosen, for now, not to shoot down the balloon after a recommendation from Pentagon officials that doing so would risk debris hitting people on the ground, according to a senior defense official who was not authorized to speak publicly. Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/02/02/us/politics/china-spy-balloon-pentagon.html published on 2023-02-03 01:00:23
